results.title: The Reluctant delinquent
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship of delinquency to learning disabilities using the case of Robbie Gamble, who is being held in a maximum security facility for juveniles. After many years of failure in school, he is learning to read in special education classes.

results.title: The Refiners fire
results.creator_credit: C Hemenway, R. Grossman, K Beasley, Doubleday Multi Media and Entropy
results.brief_description: A film produced by high school students, employing animated squares and circles depicting a situation in which a person with new ideas, may influence some, but is often persecuted by the majority. Provides a discussion point on leadership, resistance to change and group dynamics.

results.title: The Referee
results.creator_credit: Robert King, Football Association and Kay Laboratories
results.brief_description: How Association Football referees are selected and trained by the County Associations and the Referees Societies of Britain. The duties and essential qualities of a referee are explained and examples of situations during actual play which call for arbitration are shown.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Real Mobile
results.brief_description: Presents varied attractions of the city of Mobile, Alabama. Shows the city’s family life, historical background, beautiful gardens and includes shots of acrobatic water skiing, swimming, boating, tennis, golf and riding.

results.title: The Rainbow and the forest
results.brief_description: Of all the butterflies in the British Isles, the “Purple Emperor” is in a class of its own. Apart from the fact that it is so magnificent, most people have never been priviledged to see it in the wild, and collectors regard it as the greatest prize of all. The entire development of this butterfly - the forests it lives in, and its unusual habits were captured on film by a small team who virtually lived with these insects for a year.

results.title: The Raft of the Medusa: five voices on colonies, nations and histories
results.brief_description: Canadian documentary filmmaker Julian Samuel presents an intellectual discourse on world history from the birth of civilization to modern day with particular focus on the Orient. In order to maintain a balanced non-European perspective, analytical interviews are conducted with Amin Maalouf (writer - ‘Leon L’African’), Thierry Hentsch (specialist, international relations - ‘Imagining the Middle East’), Nourbese Philip (writer/critic - ‘Looking for Livingstone’, ‘Frontiers’), Sara Suleri (writer/critic - ‘The Rhetoric of English India’) and Ackbar Abbas (critic - commentator on Walter Benjamin and Hong Kong cinema). This excellent and informative program covers social, economical, political, cultural and religious issues including colonialism and imperialism; capitalism and communism; European, African and Asian histories; East/West relations; fundamentalism and secularism; and major historical events such as the partition of India in 1947, the political separation of Hong Kong from China in 1949 and Hong Kong’s future with the ending of British rule by 1997, the emancipation of slaves, Occidental modernism and the rise of Islamic fundamentalism. Contains some b&w archival footage. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Question tree
results.brief_description: Dramatised incidents are used in discussing some of the basic elements of research, and to show typical activities such as cryonics, brain research, research into the living cell, language translation, and light amplification (laser). Points out that the key to progress in research is in determining which question to ask and which problems are ready to be solved.

results.title: The Pussycat that ran away
results.brief_description: Two boys spend the summer on a dairy farm in Norway. When one of them is unkind to the other his cat is so disappointed in him that he runs away. During the search that follows Eric learns a great deal including the importance of obeying his parents and of being kind to his brother.
